commit_message:
Log the correct request type of a subrequest downstream of copy

Before this change, subrequests made while servicing a copy would
result in logging the request type from the copy PUT/GET request
instead of the type from the subrequest being logged.

In order to have the correct requst type logged for subrequests:
- Changed subrequest environments to not inherit the orig_req_method
  of the enclosing request.
- Changed copy to be more picky about when it sets orig_req_method

In addition, subrequest environments will no longer inherit the
swift.log_info from the enclosing request.  That inheritance had
been added at Ic96a92e938589a2f6add35a40741fd062f1c29eb
along with swift.orig_req_method.

Change-Id: I1ccb2665b6cd2887659e548e55a26aa00de879e3
Closes-Bug: #1657246
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/04/444604/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016-2017 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import unittest from swift.common.middleware import copy, proxy_logging from swift.common.swob import Request, HTTPOk from swift.common.wsgi import make_subrequest from test.unit import FakeLogger from test.unit.common.middleware.helpers import FakeSwift class FakeApp(object): def __init__(self, subrequest_type, app, logger): self.body = ['FAKE APP'] self.subrequest_type = subrequest_type self.app = app self.logger = logger def __call__(self, env, start_response): # Make a subrequest that will be logged hdrs = {'content-type': 'text/plain'} sub_req = make_subrequest(env, path='/v1/a/c/o2', method=self.subrequest_type, headers=hdrs, agent='FakeApp', swift_source='FA') fs_app = FakeSwift() fs_app.register(self.subrequest_type, '/v1/a/c/o2', HTTPOk, headers=hdrs) proxy_logging_app = proxy_logging.ProxyLoggingMiddleware(fs_app, {}) proxy_logging_app.access_logger = self.logger sub_req.get_response(proxy_logging_app) self.app(env, start_response) start_response('200 OK', [('Content-Type', 'text/plain')]) while env['wsgi.input'].read(5): pass return self.body class TestSubRequestLogging(unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): self.path = '/v1/a/c/o' def _setup_copy_app(self, subrequest_type, app, logger, post_as_copy=False): # Set up a pipeline of copy - FakeApp - proxy-logging conf = {'object_post_as_copy': post_as_copy} fake_app = FakeApp(subrequest_type, app, logger) return copy.filter_factory(conf)(fake_app) def _test_subrequest_logged(self, post_as_copy): # Test that subrequests made downstream from a # Copy PUT will be logged with the request type of # the subrequest as opposed to the PUT. app = FakeSwift() hdrs = {'content-type': 'text/plain'} req = Request.blank(self.path, method='PUT', headers=hdrs) app.register('PUT', self.path, HTTPOk, headers=hdrs) types = ['HEAD', 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT'] for subrequest_type in types: logger = FakeLogger() copy_app = self._setup_copy_app(subrequest_type, app, logger, post_as_copy=post_as_copy) req.get_response(copy_app) info_log_lines = logger.get_lines_for_level('info') self.assertEqual(len(info_log_lines), 1) self.assertTrue(subrequest_type in info_log_lines[0]) def test_subrequest_logged_fast_post(self): self._test_subrequest_logged(post_as_copy=False) def test_subrequest_logged_post_as_copy(self): self._test_subrequest_logged(post_as_copy=True) if __name__ == '__main__': unittest.main()

commit_message:
Set HOST_IP for subnode first

This changes how we manipulate the local.conf for the subnodes so that
HOST_IP happens first not last in the local stanza.

Change-Id: I7f0d9bfe53d769e3168ca36d04983f1cd68d9e6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/78/448078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rm -f /tmp/tmp_sub_localconf # Build a custom local.conf for the subnode that has HOST_IP # encoded. We do the HOST_IP add early so that it's a variable # that can be used by other stanzas later. $DSCONF setlc /tmp/tmp_sub_localconf "HOST_IP" "$NODE" $DSCONF merge_lc /tmp/tmp_sub_localconf "$sub_localconf"

subject: Fix lock contention in SolidFire driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 22:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/solidfire/test_solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6cf3756c4993faeb6fe2ba18b0612cc3b6af95c7', 'message': "Fix lock contention in SolidFire driver

I'm an idiot an introduced a double lock around the
same resource here:
    commit fb9ed782f1cac63a16f1f41f4e45c6c1031bff81

This patch removes the lock decorator from the inner
_do_clone method and puts a common source lock around
the public calls to clone and clone-from-snapshot,
while preserving the intent of the image-id lock around
clone_image.

Change-Id: If9145dbaf3678522beea14c613055049f5757a98
Closes-Bug: #1673264
(cherry picked from commit eceade74b8b86f8e481f3b8ab2073e0b3d90aa47)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix lock contention in SolidFire driver

I'm an idiot an introduced a double lock around the
same resource here:
    commit fb9ed782f1cac63a16f1f41f4e45c6c1031bff81

This patch removes the lock decorator from the inner
_do_clone method and puts a common source lock around
the public calls to clone and clone-from-snapshot,
while preserving the intent of the image-id lock around
clone_image.

Change-Id: If9145dbaf3678522beea14c613055049f5757a98
Closes-Bug: #1673264
(cherry picked from commit eceade74b8b86f8e481f3b8ab2073e0b3d90aa47)

commit_message:
Add helper method to add additional data about policy rule.

We need operators to understand what the policy rules mean without
looking at the code. To fix this we improve the description set in the
oslo.policy RuleDefault.

This patch introduces a helper method create_rule_default to ensure we
create consistent descriptions for all the policy rules. This helper
method would be changed to use DocumentedRuleDefault once new version
of oslo.policy is released.

Also, this patch adds description to policies in
nova/policies/server_tags.py

blueprint policy-docs

Change-Id: Ibf403bb5c05f3cef93f5a7cbb9eab95381a733a8

commit_message:
Still wait for hooks on failed resources

Previously, if a resource was in a FAILED state Heat would set the hook
but not wait for the user to clear it before continuing. It is not clear
what case this was designed to handle, since there's no way that I know
of for the resource to go into a FAILED state while waiting for the
hook.

Change-Id: Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71
Closes-Bug: #1665699
(cherry picked from commit 5cd7ff3fa66779bb7db9bf36e55e95863bbfa0e9)

commit_message:
Support to add/remove multi users for "group add/remove user"

Similar delete commands in OSC, we can also support add/remove
multi users for one specified group, this review implement it.

Change-Id: I8ccf99d4ee83a18778fa3ff5c0a42bc7c6ff21fb
Implements: bp support-multi-add-remove

subject: Ignore current share's size in extend quota bar
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-21 14:28:59.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/shares/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui/commit/ed93d4eb3b35569e3bccd2f2f7adcf6d0bd3cd9c', 'message': "Ignore current share's size in extend quota bar

The progress bar displaying the currently used quota in the 'Extend Share'
panel includes the size of the share to be extended. While this is not
wrong in itself, the share's new size is then added on top which double-counts
the share's quota and leads to a wrongly displayed progress bar.

This patch proposes to remove the current share's size from the used
quota, which avoids the mentioned issue and also aligns this panel with
what is displayed in other projects when extending the size of a resource.

Change-Id: If82ed6f45c6d1f364624dfbf54f2112fcd8093df
Closes-Bug: #1650292
(cherry picked from commit a714f4feaa93c68cdf72c7432d7b0d3fe89433b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore current share's size in extend quota bar

The progress bar displaying the currently used quota in the 'Extend Share'
panel includes the size of the share to be extended. While this is not
wrong in itself, the share's new size is then added on top which double-counts
the share's quota and leads to a wrongly displayed progress bar.

This patch proposes to remove the current share's size from the used
quota, which avoids the mentioned issue and also aligns this panel with
what is displayed in other projects when extending the size of a resource.

Change-Id: If82ed6f45c6d1f364624dfbf54f2112fcd8093df
Closes-Bug: #1650292
(cherry picked from commit a714f4feaa93c68cdf72c7432d7b0d3fe89433b7)

commit_message:
Fix issues with updating project/domain members

Update project/domain members in Identity panel does not
work if the member user id has underscores in it. This change
fixes the issue by providing a more generic JavaScript function.

Change-Id: Ied1fd65e2ed8e90def68125db9fc1061af26cccb
Closes-Bug: #1464403

commit_message:
Enable Ocata Amulet Tests

- Add Zesty as a supported series to metadata.yaml.
- Turn on Xenial-Ocata Amulet test definitions.
- Sync charm helpers to get Juju 2.x amulet compatibility.
- Keeping Zesty-Ocata Amulet test definitions turned off until the
  metadata.yaml changes propagate to the charm store.

Change-Id: I6f59db20a955a00fb3497095de683f93680537ec

commit_message:
DELETE all inventory for a resource provider

This patch adds a new method for deleting all inventories for a
resource provider: DELETE /resource-providers/{uuid}/inventories

Return codes:
204 NoContent on success
404 NotFound if the resource provider does not exist
405 MethodNotAllowed if a microversion is specified that is before
    this change (1.5)
409 Conflict if inventory in use or if some other request concurrently
    updates this resource provider

Change-Id: I1ecb12c888f873e8330367c8411d5a2ef0458495
Implements: bp delete-inventories-placement-api

commit_message:
add spec for instance flavor API

Replace the existing ``flavor`` property in the ``server`` representation to
include most of the flavor information stored with the instance, instead of the
current flavor ID and link.

APIImpact
blueprint: instance-flavor-api

Change-Id: I8e3af79efff0b52a523e5f7ec67812c29e0281ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/82/265282/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Instance Flavor REST API ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/instance-flavor-api Create a new ``flavor`` sub resource of ``server`` to access the flavor information stored with the instance, instead of the global flavor definition. Problem description =================== The REST representation of our ``server`` resource includes links to other resources (flavor and image) used to create that server. These link to global REST representations ``/v2.1/flavor/{id}``. However, flavors can be deleted, so this resource may no longer be available. Internal to Nova we now story the flavor information with an instance when we first create it, to protect ourselves from just such deletes. In order to provide these same guaruntees to the users, we should expose a flavor sub resource on ``server``, and use this in all our server representations. Use Cases --------- What use cases does this address? What impact on actors does this change have? Ensure you are clear about the actors in each use case: Developer, End User, Deployer etc. Proposed change =============== Propose a new microversion which adds the following sub resource and route:: GET /v2.1/servers/{id}/flavor The response will be largely the same as the flavor response with the following fields removed: * id - there is no id associated with this, it is accessed by subresource * links - as a sub resource persistent links seem less important * name - there is no reason to expose the name for the flavor * os-flavor-access:is_public - irrelevant, this is scope local to the instance * OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled - irrelevant, this is scope local to the instance In any other cases where flavor information had odd keys because it was considered and extension, we will normalize those keys. For instance ``OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral`` would become ``ephemeral``. All REST calls that return flavor links will return links to these new resources instead. Alternatives ------------ * Not allow the deletion of flavors. This has impacts on Cells v2, which we would like to avoid. * Add these attributes directly to the server representation itself, which would remove a REST call when attempting to look up the details. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- * URL: * /v2.1/servers/{server_id}/flavor * Request Method: * GET * JSON response:: { "flavor": { "disk": 1, "ephemeral": 0, "ram": 512, "swap": "", "vcpus": 1 } } * Normal response code: * 200: Success * Error response code: * 404: Not Found - if asking for this resource at a microversion < what it is introduced at. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None that is known. Performance Impact ------------------ None that is known. The db operations shouldn't be any more expensive than the ones we currently have. Other deployer impact --------------------- After this microversion is out there, server representations >= that microversion will have these new links. Those links will only exist if the same or great microverion. Developer impact ---------------- Anyone that currently consumes flavor information may want to adjust to this new model. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sdague Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Testing will be done in tree with samples / functional testing. Tempest testing may be added once microversion testing support is in tree. Documentation Impact ==================== API documentation will need to be updated. References ========== This general approach surfaced during the Mitaka summit in conversations.

commit_message:
Fix Telegraf startup config files issue

Telegraf allow plugin configuration in /etc/telegraf/telegraf.d
directory. These files comes from telegraf/templates/config/*.conf,
but this directory is optional.

Closes-Bug: #1673691

Change-Id: Idc695c86c5f6b6b0bd514728f2025321cd200907

commit_message:
Improve multiple create server tests

multiple create server tests just verify the
reservation id in response.

Let's check whether the requested number of servers
got created or not.

commit_message:
Fix Magnum Kolla demo in contrib

Magnum demo scripts doesn't work cause compose/openstack.env
doesn't exist anymore.
* NETWORK_MANAGER check has been removed
* script has been updated to use Openstack client instead of
deprecated clients (neutron-client, glance-client).
* Magnum client calls have been adapted too.
* some enhancements (logs, variable) have been performed too.

Change-Id: I294b1876c9c7090785c0ebdd09b43843f88fb00b
Closes-Bug: #1670618

commit_message:
Nova BFV by reserving volume

Update nova to use the new cinder attach API and support booting from
existing volumes that are still in the creating state.

Change-Id: Ic890b776e94df163bba539deeb7525e1377c704e
Implements: blueprint bfv-with-reserved-volume
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/41/417541/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Nova BFV by reserving volume ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/bfv-with-reserved-volume Cinder change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387712/ provides the mechanics to reserve a volume while it is in creating or downloading state. This can be leveraged by the nova boot from volume procedure so that BFV will not have to wait for the volume to be completely available. To avoid waiting for volume to be available, the BFV will need to call the cinder API to reserve the volume which creation is running on the background, and BFV returns with creation job running on the background till volume is available and instance is created. This way, the user can program the operation without having to wait and check volume object availability. Problem description =================== If you use the nova Boot From Volume (BFV) workflow you can not specify a cinder volume-type on the request. As a result the volume is always created in the default volume-type as defined by the default_volume_type option in cinder.conf (if default_volume_type is not set then one of the backends is randomly selected by the cinder scheduler service). In a tiered storage deployment this means users have to first pre-create the volume, wait for the volume to be created, and then boot onto it if they want anything other then the default. Ideally the solution to this problem is to extend the nova API to accept volume-type as an optional field on the BFV call. After 2 cycles of discussion we have been unable to get agreement from the nova core team to pursue this route. Nova has taken that stance that the proper way to address this is to simply create a volume using cinder and boot from that volume. The main problem with this is that you have to create the volume and wait for it to become "available" before you issue the boot command. If the status of a volume is not "available" the nova API will reject the request as invalid. Today this is done in the check_attach function of the compute API, however nova core plans on merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/335358/ which will remove the check_attach code and will instead rely on cinder's reserve volume call. The reserve volume call uses similar logic to the nova API in that it won't allow you "reserve" a volume if its isn't in the "available" or "in-use" (for multiattach only) state. Additionally the reserve volume call changes the status of the volume to "attaching" which isn't accurate at all because its not actually "attaching" rather someone has expressed that they intend to attach to the volume at some future time. Cinder change (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387712/) provides granular state what allows nova BFV to be able to reserve and wait for the volume to be available. Use Cases --------- The use case is Nova BFV with volume not being at "available" state. This blueprint impacts Nova developers, reviewers and users. Proposed change =============== We propose to change the reserve volume call such that it will allow for the reserving of a volume that is in the "creating" or "downloading" state. Since we now want to "reserve" a volume that is still in a transitory state ("creating" or "downloading") we wish to change the way the reserve volume call works such that it does not need to change the status to "attaching". We propose that we extend the existing attach_status field to indicate a reserved volume. The attach_status field today have two values "attached" and "detached". This cinder change (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387712/) propose more granular states e.g "pending". When a reserve call is made the status and attach_status of the volume will be checked and assuming the attach could proceed the attach_status field will be updated to "pending". The code for the reserve volume call would look something like the following. NOTE: This code has not been tested and may not be complete. diff --git a/cinder/volume/api.py b/cinder/volume/api.py index d964eeb..5202cfc 100644 --- a/cinder/volume/api.py +++ b/cinder/volume/api.py @@ -613,10 +613,14 @@ class API(base.Base): @wrap_check_policy def reserve_volume(self, context, volume): expected = {'multiattach': volume.multiattach, - 'status': (('available', 'in-use') if volume.multiattach - else 'available')} - - result = volume.conditional_update({'status': 'attaching'}, expected) + 'attach_status': ('detatched',), + 'status': ('available', 'creating', 'downloading')} + if volume.multiattach: + expected['attach_status'] += ('attached',) + expected['status'] += ('in-use',) + + result = volume.conditional_update({'attach_status': 'pending'}, + expected) if not result: expected_status = utils.build_or_str(expected['status']) In addition to the changes to the reserve volume call the unreserve volume call would also need to be updated to account for this change. Additionally there are handful of locations in the code base today where the attach_status of the volume is checked. Those locations would have to be updated to account for the new status of "pending". Once the cinder side of things is completed, nova needs to be updated to utilization this new functionality. Depending on how the functionality is implemented in cinder (micro versions etc) work may have to be done to allow nova to use the new reserve volume functionality. Additionally the logic on the nova-compute node that waits for a volume to become available before booting the VM will also need to be updated to wait when a request is made to boot from an existing volume (see the changes to nova/virt/block_device.py in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391444/ for info). Alternatives ------------ Nova boot with specific volume type specified at "block_device_mapping_v2" https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-volume-type-when-boot-instances . However, this solution was denied by Nova core team not to overload Nova parameter interface Data model impact ----------------- No database schema change is needed. Nova DB shall reflect BFV job status with reserved volume waiting for volume to be available REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The python-novaclient "nova" boot from volume will be able to boot from volume while the volume is still in "creating" or "downloading" state. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- <tbd> Work Items ---------- See proposed solution Dependencies ============ Cinder change (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387712/) Testing ======= Tempest test nova boot from volume (BFV) needs to be updated to cover cases of volume in different state Documentation Impact ==================== Documents of nova BFV will need to be updated to describe the new functionality and behavior. References ========== 1. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/bfv-with-reserved-volume 2. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387712 3. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391444 4. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/335358 History =======

commit_message:
compute: create one pollster to rule them all

Currently each compute pollster polls the backend for each
metric of each instance while almost all backends can retrieve all stats
at once (all except xenapi).

This change reworks the compute pollsters to make one inspector call to
retrieve data for an instance.

The cache structure is simplified a lot by removing the useless intermediate
object.

We now cache the cpu stats, since putting the polling of an instance
twice in polling.yaml is a non sense. We don't care if the second poll
have a wrong timestamp due to the caching.

Related-Bug: 1670948
Change-Id: Id90f701cef261e165b63f0ba92a35cecfed659e7

commit_message:
Add command_prefix field to puppet mcagent

This will allow to run puppet with environment variables.
E.g. FACTER_foo=bar puppet apply ...

Change-Id: I1e435262e810ead46689078513607f6a99a19043
Implements: blueprint get-rid-cobbler-dnsmasq
(cherry picked from commit c734b030420c8ad78038ec5790e606f0c24ef616)
(cherry picked from commit ec4abb2573133af439666160d9c873fceea4b4c9)

commit_message:
Optimize the devstack setup for wsgi deployment

1. Rename zun_error.log to zun_api.log
2. Start the zun-api and create two tabs in devstack screen:
the first tab is for taling the zun_api.log, the second tab
is for tailing the zun_access.log

Change-Id: I10a75c09e7a577615c331ceb0f422375443afeee
Closes-Bug: #1674028

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Remove log translations Log messages are no longer being translated. This
removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify
logging and to avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I35f03250707b8103b6f6b12cb16a1ebcea2aa925
Signed-off-by: Ranler Cao <caoran@fiberhome.com>
Closes-Bug: #1674547
Signed-off-by: Ranler Cao <caoran@fiberhome.com>

commit_message:
move fedora 25 to experimental on d-g and devstack

The fedora 25 job is failing hard on a ton of tempest tests to the
point where it basically always is taking the full 3 hr timeout value
to fail. With this level of failure we should move from check-nv to
experimental, so that it's not just adding 1.5hrs of turn around time
to d-g and devstack changes.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 15:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/baremetal', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/localhost', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/target', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-configdrives-dynamic/defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/675bb34386e8b0b5df53e69dfe4537d00749c4be', 'message': 'Use env lookup to determine HOME for SSH pubkey

Following the merge of
https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/1236d9343ec16b4166f923bd62e3153ad86fd350,
facts are no longer gathered in the deploy-dynamic.yaml playbook. The
default value for the ssh_public_key_path variable references a host
fact (ansible_env) which is therefore now invalid.

This change uses the env lookup to determine the HOME environment
variable, since we are actually referring to the home of the user

Change-Id: I3642186e188f8a880246965dbf667ada992cc135

commit_message:
Use env lookup to determine HOME for SSH pubkey

Following the merge of
https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/1236d9343ec16b4166f923bd62e3153ad86fd350,
facts are no longer gathered in the deploy-dynamic.yaml playbook. The
default value for the ssh_public_key_path variable references a host
fact (ansible_env) which is therefore now invalid.

This change uses the env lookup to determine the HOME environment
variable, since we are actually referring to the home of the user
executing Ansible rather than the remote user.

Change-Id: I3642186e188f8a880246965dbf667ada992cc135
Closes-Bug: #1665681
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/03/435503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ssh_public_key_path: "{{ lookup('env', 'HOME') }}/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"

commit_message:
tempest: Log server console output of failed SSH

Tempest has a code in its base class. As we inherit from API base class
in tempest tests, we lost this capability. This patch adds a copy from
tempest code.

Change-Id: I24fc7e4c5f2726a16af15288987e65b77532e709
(cherry picked from commit f33df80f1610071f28b200e02a025b267a0310af)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/447585/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc def check_connectivity(self, host, ssh_user, ssh_key, servers=None): ssh_client = ssh.Client(host, ssh_user, pkey=ssh_key) try: ssh_client.test_connection_auth() except lib_exc.SSHTimeout as ssh_e: LOG.debug(ssh_e) self._log_console_output(servers) raise def _log_console_output(self, servers=None): if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.console_output: LOG.debug('Console output not supported, cannot log') return if not servers: servers = self.manager.servers_client.list_servers() servers = servers['servers'] for server in servers: try: console_output = ( self.manager.servers_client.get_console_output( server['id'])['output']) LOG.debug('Console output for %s\nbody=\n%s', server['id'], console_output) except lib_exc.NotFound: LOG.debug("Server %s disappeared(deleted) while looking " "for the console log", server['id'])
deleted_lines: def check_connectivity(cls, host, ssh_user, ssh_key=None): ssh_client = ssh.Client(host, ssh_user, pkey=ssh_key) ssh_client.test_connection_auth() @classmethod

commit_message:
trunk: Add tempest test validating subport connectivity

The patch uses commands over SSH to define VLAN interfaces within
guests.

Test creates two instances with one trunk port and one subport - each
port is on different network. Connectivity is tested
using ping from one instance to the addresses on VLAN interfaces of the
other instance.

Change-Id: Iac801621c19ad488ea6210401f73f76564e4a9d3
(cherry picked from commit 1eed96f523fe65af6c09dd97e75a7ff772bedd7f)

flavor_ref=CONF.compute.flavor_ref, image_ref=CONF.compute.image_ref, key_name=self.keypair['name'], networks=[{'port': port_id}], security_groups=[{'name': self.secgroup[ 'security_group']['name']}], 'port_id': port_for_subport['id'], 'segmentation_type': 'vlan', 'segmentation_id': vlan_tag} trunk = self.client.create_trunk( parent_port['id'], subports=[subport])['trunk'] server, fip = for i in range(2)] for server in servers: self._wait_for_server(server) # Configure VLAN interfaces on server command = CONFIGURE_VLAN_INTERFACE_COMMANDS % {'tag': vlan_tag} commit_message:
Change default to skip snapshot cycles

The snapshots we take after each installation step are mostly used for
debugging. Regular users seem to prefer build speed. This patch changes
the default to skipping the snapshot cycles (and quite a few reboots).

The option '-q' is now ignored. A new option '-e' to re-enable the
snapshot cycles has been added to st.py and repeat-test.sh.

Change-Id: I054cad556a11963f7df8ba65af85bde843a23656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/72/447272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: snapshot_cycle = False

subject: Allow libvirt rbd params to be independent of cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 22:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/libvirt-rbd-independent-5876349073463cc3.yaml', 'templates/nova.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/8a7f84ca419c1017b590ac688765939992433919', 'message': 'Allow libvirt rbd params to be independent of cinder

Currently, nova.conf libvirt settings deploy rbd parameters
based on the value of ``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse``.

This patch adds a new variable ``nova_libvirt_rbd_inuse``
to make this section independent of cinder backends in
the case when ``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse`` is true and the
rbd parameters are not desireable in nova.conf.

``nova_libvirt_rbd_inuse`` defaults to the value set by
``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse`` to maintain existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ia5eeaada717424895b81fc7f26b4d7e7af62165b
'}]
commit_message:
Allow libvirt rbd params to be independent of cinder

Currently, nova.conf libvirt settings deploy rbd parameters
based on the value of ``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse``.

This patch adds a new variable ``nova_libvirt_rbd_inuse``
to make this section independent of cinder backends in
the case when ``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse`` is true and the
rbd parameters are not desireable in nova.conf.

``nova_libvirt_rbd_inuse`` defaults to the value set by
``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse`` to maintain existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ia5eeaada717424895b81fc7f26b4d7e7af62165b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/53/409353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova_libvirt_rbd_inuse: "{{ cinder_backends_rbd_inuse | default(False) }}"

commit_message:
Log git information in repeat-test.sh and st.py

With this patch, repeat-test and st.py log the current state of the git
tree. This makes is easier to find out which version of the code
produced a particular set of log files.

Change-Id: If023a77d4b4522e730f8cee097114d21442168e4

commit_message:
Downgrade callback abortable event log to debug

These callbacks perform validation of user behaviors so
logging an ERROR isn't the right thing to do here. A debug
statement is all that is necessary since any unexpected exceptions
will be logged by the exception handler in the API layer.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Replace "sid" and "testing" by "stretch"

Supported Debian distros (codenames) are "sid", "testing",
and "jessie", but it should be "stretch" and "jessie".

"testing" is no codename and therefore should be replaced by
"stretch".

"sid" changes all the time and cannot be guaranteed to run
correctly or is at least not tested.

Change-Id: Id4b80a055452bbff69036d4dc1adeda46ce99664
Closes-Bug: #1673810
Closes-Bug: #1674416

commit_message:
Allow libvirt rbd params to be independent of cinder

Removed dependency for ``cinder_backends_rbd_inuse`` in nova.conf
when setting ``rbd_user`` and ``rbd_secret_uuid`` variables.
Cinder delivers all necessary values via RPC when attaching the
volume, so those variables are only necessary for ephemeral
disks stored in Ceph. These variables are required to be set up
on cinder-volume side under backend section.

Change-Id: If505dc58b4adb46e08230b0482d48d8898529460
Closes-Bug: #1673570

commit_message:
Fix Cinder upgrade jobs

The cinder upgrade job needs to run with the os_cinder-overrides.yml
overrides file otherwise the tempest tests that run will be too wide and
expect services that are not available (e.g. nova).

Change-Id: Ifadac49447edf2e0fd33fe04974386b2d6256935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/12/448112/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ANSIBLE_OVERRIDES=${ANSIBLE_OVERRIDES:-$WORKING_DIR/tests/os_cinder-overrides.yml} export ANSIBLE_CLI_PARAMETERS="${ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS} -e @${ANSIBLE_OVERRIDES}"

commit_message:
remove deprecated scheduler filter parameters

The following parameters were moved top level during the Newton
cycle and I propose these are now removed:
cpu_allocation_ratio
ram_allocation_ratio
disk_allocation_ratio

Change-Id: Ib028bad7d5edce4bb14359388558502f3745599d
Closes-Bug: #1673781

This patch gets ironic virt driver to support soft reboot.

Before this patch, ironic virt driver ignores boot_type and always does
hard reboot. For the backward compatibility, this patch bumps API
microversion. To change the behavior of ironic virt driver depending on
microversion, RPC API and virt driver API are also changed to receive
a flag.

Especially, the virt driver API change will break out of tree virt
drivers.

This patch depends on an ironic feature to support soft reboot. To use
the feature, ironic API version will be bumped.

Change-Id: I4e61ebf852f61e3c0a511b49f0304d3138ef022e
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff

commit_message:
Ironic: Add soft reboot support to ironic driver

This patch gets Ironic virt driver to support soft reboot.

Ironic API supports soft reboot since  API version 1.27. The API
version has already been bumped to 1.28.

Change-Id: I4e61ebf852f61e3c0a511b49f0304d3138ef022e
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>
Co-Authored-By: xiexs <xiexs@cn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/403745/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def reboot(self, context, instance, reboot_type, ironic_soft=False): self._soft_reboot(context, instance, reboot_type=reboot_type, ironic_soft=ironic_soft) def _soft_reboot(self, context, instance, reboot_type="SOFT", ironic_soft=False): reboot_type=reboot_type, ironic_soft=ironic_soft)
deleted_lines: def reboot(self, context, instance, reboot_type): self._soft_reboot(context, instance) def _soft_reboot(self, context, instance): reboot_type='SOFT')

subject: Expose ha_state property from HA enabled L3 Agents.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 16:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_agent.py', 'openstack/network/v2/agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/3bde55272f4899ee9e89df3edf3e4b6edf23b5be', 'message': "Expose ha_state property from HA enabled L3 Agents.

The blueprint 'Report HA Router Master' describes how the REST interface
now exposes the HA state of a L3 agent.

The property is connected to the L3 agent instance which represents the
router. As such it represents the state of a single L3 agent router
instance, and will return different state for different L3 agents
connected to the same router. I.e. a HA router is implemented by (at
least) two L3 agent instances, and those instances will have different

Change-Id: I30fc4cec3efb98aa37c6173ffecaf9ade7e2d212
"}]
commit_message:
Expose ha_state property from HA enabled L3 Agents.

The blueprint 'Report HA Router Master' describes how the REST interface
now exposes the HA state of a L3 agent.

The property is connected to the L3 agent instance which represents the
router. As such it represents the state of a single L3 agent router
instance, and will return different state for different L3 agents
connected to the same router. I.e. a HA router is implemented by (at
least) two L3 agent instances, and those instances will have different
states.

This patch exposes this property for the openstack.network.v2.Agent
class, making it available for inspection.

Change-Id: I30fc4cec3efb98aa37c6173ffecaf9ade7e2d212

commit_message:
Avoid imports in openstack/__init__.py

These imports are creating problems when installing sdk. The problem
might be caused by new pbr logics. However, I think fixing them from
SDK side is much easier.

Change-Id: I2f028e383d790edd1c28dea74056b96e87fe285c
Related-Bug: #1672238

commit_message:
[Grenade] Fix devstack configuration in CI hook

Commit [1] fixed approach for setting devstack config according to
changes [2] in devstack. But it started updating only 1 of 2 possible
devstack directories that are 'old' and 'new'. Where 'old' is the one
that is used only in 'grenade' job as base installation for performing
project migration. 'new' is used in all other single-devstack
installations. So, with [1] everything started working except
'grenade' job.
Fix grenade job by copying devstack config to 'old' dir if it exists.

[1] Idfa8e0cb3f446361daa1449e0854d95cfb379f46
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html

Change-Id: Ic00a1fe296fa68a65672fa680ebd8a9336ed7cef
(cherry picked from commit 0b3fce7a04e79afd7bbf623baa380677ee5ba2e7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/79/438679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Required for "grenade" job that uses devstack config from 'old' directory. if [[ -d "$BASE/old/devstack" ]]; then cp $localconf $BASE/old/devstack/local.conf fi

commit_message:
Update Fluentd config to log in Kibana dashboard

Fluent rewrite_tag_filter output plugin must be updated for the
following services:

* Congress
* Designate
* Freezer
* Manila
* Murano
* Octavia
* Senlin
* Trove
* Watcher

Change-Id: I5329002c99f5c940921dff107f2120bafb158168
Closes-Bug: #1673208

commit_message:
Updated bootstrap repos after fuel-bootstrap-cli reinstall

Default fuel-bootstrap-cli conf file which is provided
by the package does not contain repos. We need to update
repos from astute.yaml before being able to build bootstrap
image.

Change-Id: I30ed1c372e7b2107f810e784c1d56807d3412527
Closes-Bug: #1644411
(cherry picked from commit bd45d96f3954afa5a4368b989bf969c7e81eb5f0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/99/415199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: astute_yaml_path = "/etc/fuel/astute.yaml" with YamlEditor(astute_yaml_path, ip=actions.admin_ip) as editor: repos = editor.content["BOOTSTRAP"]["repos"] repos.append({ 'name': 'auxiliary', 'priority': "1200", 'section': 'main restricted', 'suite': 'auxiliary', 'type': 'deb', 'uri': 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/ubuntu/auxiliary/'}) with YamlEditor(path, ip=actions.admin_ip) as editor: editor.content['repos'] = repos
deleted_lines: new_repo = {'name': 'auxiliary', 'priority': "1200", 'section': 'main restricted', 'suite': 'auxiliary', 'type': 'deb', 'uri': 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/ubuntu/auxiliary/'} with YamlEditor(path, ip=actions.admin_ip) as editor: editor.content['repos'].append(new_repo)

commit_message:
get_model method missing for Ploop image

Image.get_model is called in partition injection code,
and now inject partition attempt fails unconditionally.
This patch makes use of disk/api.py inject_data failure tolerance:
it doesn't fail unless injected data is mandatory.

Closes-Bug: 1670642
Change-Id: I6c68693be818219f78d6fcda019b867066396b29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/89/441989/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Force DB Migrate on openstack-upgrade

The is_db_initialised function was stopping migrate_database from
performing the migration when running an openstack-upgrade. Add
upgrade kwarg to guarantee the migration runs.

Change-Id: I4f71f34f752f49992774e3d44e9105d35ca32d80
Closes-bug: #1674457
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder refs/changes/74/447674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def migrate_database(upgrade=False): if not upgrade and is_db_intialised(): migrate_database(upgrade=True)

commit_message:
Fix Manage Replicas button availability

Some share types don't support replication. It should be checked along with
the replication availability itself to make "Manage Replicas" button properly
enabled or disabled.

Depends-On: I2510174b6790aa6defaed5b8bf804875eb888ebc
Change-Id: I736e993125870b44b4105d544ab433692a04b657
Closes-Bug: #1619244
(cherry picked from commit b8fd858d63a8e6b1beff84fd37b6ffae057d83bf)

commit_message:
[Core] Create new plugin based class for credentials

* Moved credential class from rally.objects to rally.deployment.
* Added OpenStackCredential plugin.
* Simplified getting of osclients.
* Enabled client caching on OpenStackCredential plugin.

spec: deployment_type.rst

Change-Id: I9ac8c4989c681885534683bd4ee4bc34fcfabaac

commit_message:
Enable Ocata Amulet Tests

- Add Zesty as a supported series to metadata.yaml.
- Turn on Xenial-Ocata Amulet test definitions.
- Sync charm helpers to get Juju 2.x amulet compatibility.
- Keeping Zesty-Ocata Amulet test definitions turned off until the
  metadata.yaml changes propagate to the charm store.

Change-Id: I182fffbbfc6e3d475e0d23c58998c997645b9387

commit_message:
Remove mos-holdback from MOS 9.2

There are some trade offs in using two holdback repos. After that
commit we have mos-holdback for versions MOS 9.0 - 9.1
and mos92-holdback for 9.2+ versions

Change-Id: Iecf69c90a7711d55d0c537a4c3e56ac7f333eccc
Partial-Bug: #1663728

subject: Ignore current share's size in extend quota bar
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 15:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/shares/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui/commit/a714f4feaa93c68cdf72c7432d7b0d3fe89433b7', 'message': "Ignore current share's size in extend quota bar

The progress bar displaying the currently used quota in the 'Extend Share'
panel includes the size of the share to be extended. While this is not
wrong in itself, the share's new size is then added on top which double-counts
the share's quota and leads to a wrongly displayed progress bar.

This patch proposes to remove the current share's size from the used
quota, which avoids the mentioned issue and also aligns this panel with
what is displayed in other projects when extending the size of a resource.

Change-Id: If82ed6f45c6d1f364624dfbf54f2112fcd8093df
Closes-Bug: #1650292
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore current share's size in extend quota bar

The progress bar displaying the currently used quota in the 'Extend Share'
panel includes the size of the share to be extended. While this is not
wrong in itself, the share's new size is then added on top which double-counts
the share's quota and leads to a wrongly displayed progress bar.

This patch proposes to remove the current share's size from the used
quota, which avoids the mentioned issue and also aligns this panel with
what is displayed in other projects when extending the size of a resource.

Change-Id: If82ed6f45c6d1f364624dfbf54f2112fcd8093df
Closes-Bug: #1650292

commit_message:
Removed Netmtu_db_mixin from the tree

It's not used by any in-tree plugins, neither I am aware of any external
plugins relying on the mixin. Let's kill it.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Icecdc11a04ff381a07f44c7ca2073924f6325f44

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from neutron.api.v2 import attributes from neutron.db import db_base_plugin_v2 from neutron.extensions import netmtu from neutron.plugins.common import utils CONF = cfg.CONF # TODO(ihrachys): the class is not used in the tree; mixins are generally # discouraged these days, so maybe it's worth considering deprecation for the # class. Interested plugins would be able to ship it on their own, if they want # to stick to mixins, or implement the behaviour in another way. class Netmtu_db_mixin(object): """Mixin class to add network MTU support to db_base_plugin_v2.""" def _extend_network_dict_mtu(self, network_res, network_db): # don't use network_db argument since MTU is not persisted in database network_res[netmtu.MTU] = utils.get_deployment_physnet_mtu() return network_res db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2.register_dict_extend_funcs( attributes.NETWORKS, ['_extend_network_dict_mtu'])

add name_check to /info

Also removed a bunch of unnecessary unquotes. Just use path_info
instead (it's already unquoted).

Partial-Bug: #1670915

commit_message:
Remove old oslo.messaging transport aliases

Those are remnants from the oslo-incubator times. Also, oslo.messaging
deprecated [1] transport aliases since 5.2.0+ that is the minimal
version supported for stable/newton. The patch that bumped the minimal
version for Searchlight landed 3 months+ ago, so we can proceed ripping
those aliases from the code base.

[1] I314cefa5fb1803fa7e21e3e34300e5ced31bba89

Closes-Bug: #1424728

Change-Id: Ia270d486d0a85354df30f7e5731d4c09a3ef3727
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/71/447371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove log translations.

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I51c0f921ab5153bba7fdce02fb16145ce8e27ef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/90/447790/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: LOG.exception(_LE("String %s is not a valid isotime"), isotime)

added_lines: # BillXiang , 2016. #zanata # zzxwill , 2016. #zanata # TigerFang , 2017. #zanata msgid "" msgstr "" "Project-Id-Version: searchlight-ui 1.0.1.dev6 " "Report-Msgid-Bugs-To: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-i18n/ " "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-12-09 15:52+0000 " "MIME-Version: 1.0 " "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 " "Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit " "PO-Revision-Date: 2017-02-20 06:00+0000 " "Last-Translator: TigerFang " "Language-Team: Chinese (China) " "Language: zh-CN " "X-Generator: Zanata 3.7.3 " "Plural-Forms: nplurals=1; plural=0 " #, python-format msgid "%(resourceType)s: %(searchFacet)s" msgstr "%(resourceType)s： %(searchFacet)s" #, python-format msgid "%(total)s total results" msgstr "共有%(total)s个结果" #, python-format msgid "(%(doc_count)s)" msgstr "(%(doc_count)s)" msgid "(Extension)" msgstr "（扩展）" msgid "-" msgstr "_" msgid "" "A snapshot is an image which preserves the disk state of a running instance." msgstr "快照是一个镜像文件，它保存了一个运行中实例的状态。" #, python-format msgid "ALLOW %(type)s %(direction)s %(target)s" msgstr "允许%(type)s %(direction)s %(target)s" #, python-format msgid "ALLOW %(type)s %(ports)s %(direction)s %(target)s" msgstr "允许 %(type)s %(ports)s %(direction)s %(target)s" msgid "ANY" msgstr "任意选项" msgid "Action" msgstr "操作" msgid "Action Log" msgstr "操作日志" msgid "Actions" msgstr "操作" msgid "Active" msgstr "运行中" msgid "" "Add a '+' or a '-' to indicate terms that must or must " " not appear. For example '+python -apache web' would find " " everything that has 'python' does NOT have 'apache' and should " "have " " 'web'. This may also be used with grouping. For example, " " 'web -(apache AND python)' would find anything with 'web', but " "does " " not have either 'apache' or 'python'." msgstr "" "使用'+'或者'-'来表示短语组必须或者必须不被 " "搜索。例如'+python-apache web'会找出所有 " "包含'python'而不同时包含'apache'并且以'web' " "结尾的结果。也可以用分组的形式。例如， " "'web -(apache AND python)'会搜索出任何包含'web'， " "但既不包含'apache'也不包含'python'的结果。" msgid "Addresses" msgstr "地址" msgid "Admin State" msgstr "管理员状态" msgid "Alphabetical Name" msgstr "按字母顺序排序的名称" msgid "Attached Device" msgstr "已经挂载的设备" msgid "Attached Device ID" msgstr "已经挂载的设备ID" msgid "Attached To" msgstr "挂载到" msgid "Availability Zone" msgstr "可用域" msgid "Availability Zone Hints" msgstr "可用区域" msgid "Availability Zones" msgstr "可用域" msgid "Available" msgstr "可用配额" msgid "Binding Host ID" msgstr "绑定主机ID" msgid "Binding Profile" msgstr "绑定配置" msgid "Binding VIF Details" msgstr "绑定虚拟接口详情" msgid "Binding VIF Type" msgstr "绑定虚拟接口类型" msgid "Binding VNIC Type" msgstr "绑定虚拟网络接口卡类型" msgid "Blocked" msgstr "阻塞" msgid "Boolean Operators" msgstr "逻辑操作符" msgid "Boosting" msgstr "增加权重" msgid "Bootable" msgstr "可启动的" msgid "Build" msgstr "创建" msgid "Building" msgstr "创建中" msgid "" "By default, each word you type will be searched for " " individually. You may also try to search an exact phrase by " " using quotes ("my phrase") to surround a phrase. The search " " service may allow a certain amount of phrase slop - meaning " "that " " if you have some words out of order in the phrase it may still " " match." msgstr "" "默认情况下你输入的每个词都会被分开 " "单独搜索。你可以尝试利用引号引住想 " "搜索的准确关键词（比如“我的关键词”）。 " "搜索服务也支持一些邻近短语匹配的特性，即 " "如果你输入的语句中词语顺序有问题，它还 " "是可以按照正常情况进行匹配。" msgid "" "By default, each word you type will match full words " " only. You may also use wildcards to match parts of words. " "Wildcard " " searches can be run on individual terms, using ? to replace a " " single character, and * to replace zero or more character. " "'demo' " " will match the full word 'demo' only. However, 'de*' " " will match anything that starts with 'de', such as 'demo_1'. " " 'de*1' will match " " anything that starts with 'de' and ends with '1'." msgstr "" "默认情况下，你输入的单词只会进行全量匹配。 " "你也可以用通配符来进行部分单词的匹配。可 " "以在多种情况下使用通配符搜索，使用?代替一 " "个字母，用*代替空白或者更多字符。比如 " "搜索'demo'只会匹配'demo'这个单词。但是 " "'de*'就会匹配到所有以'de'开头的单词，比 " "如'demo_1'。'de*1'会匹配出所有以'de'开头 " "并且以‘1’结尾的单词。" msgid "Cancel" msgstr "取消" msgid "Close" msgstr "关闭" msgid "Code" msgstr "编码" msgid "Confirm Delete Instance" msgid_plural "Confirm Delete Instances" msgstr[0] "确认删除实例" msgid "Confirm Resize" msgstr "确认调整大小" msgid "Confirm or Revert Resize/Migrate" msgstr "确认或放弃调整大小/迁移" msgid "Connect" msgstr "连接" msgid "Connect in a new window" msgstr "在一个新窗口中连接" msgid "Consistency Group ID" msgstr "一致性组ID" msgid "Console" msgstr "控制台" msgid "Console is currently unavailable. Please try again later." msgstr "当前控制台不可用，请稍后重试。" msgid "Crashed" msgstr "崩溃" msgid "Create" msgstr "创建" msgid "Create Instance" msgstr "创建实例" msgid "Create Instance Snapshot" msgstr "创建实例快照" msgid "Create Snapshot" msgstr "创建快照" msgid "Created" msgstr "创建时间" msgid "Created At" msgstr "创建于" msgid "Creating Snapshot" msgstr "正在创建快照" msgid "DNS Domain" msgstr "DNS 域" msgid "DNS Domains" msgstr "DNS 域" msgid "DNS Name" msgstr "DNS名称" msgid "DNS Nameservers" msgstr "DNS域名服务器" msgid "DNS Record" msgstr "DNS记录" msgid "DNS Records" msgstr "DNS记录" msgid "" "Date, numeric or string fields can use range queries. " " Use square brackets [min TO max] for inclusive ranges and curly " " brackets {min TO max} for exclusive ranges." msgstr "" "日期、数字或者字符串都可以使用范围查询。 " "使用方括号 [min TO max]表示包含边界值，而使用 " "花括号{min TO max}表示不包含边界值。" msgid "Default Network" msgstr "默认网络" msgid "Delete" msgstr "删除" msgid "Delete Instance" msgid_plural "Delete Instances" msgstr[0] "删除实例" msgid "Deleted" msgstr "已删除" #, python-format msgid "Deleted Instance: %s." msgid_plural "Deleted Instances: %s." msgstr[0] "已被删除的实例：%s。" msgid "Deleting Instance" msgid_plural "Deleting Instances" msgstr[0] "正在删除实例" msgid "Description" msgstr "描述" msgid "Description:" msgstr "描述：" msgid "Details" msgstr "详情" msgid "Direction" msgstr "方向" msgid "Disk" msgstr "磁盘" msgid "Display field matching" msgstr "显示字段匹配" #, python-format msgid "Displaying %(numberDisplayed)s of %(total)s total results" msgstr "显示所有%(total)s条结果中的%(numberDisplayed)s条" msgid "Distributed" msgstr "分布式的" msgid "Down" msgstr "关闭" msgid "Enable DHCP" msgstr "开启DHCP" msgid "Encrypted" msgstr "已加密的" msgid "Ephemeral" msgstr "临时的" msgid "Error" msgstr "错误" #, python-format msgid "Error initializing actions for plugin %(type)s: " msgstr "对插件%(type)s的初始化操作失败，原因是：" msgid "Ether Type" msgstr "以太网类型" msgid "External" msgstr "外部的" msgid "External Network" msgstr "外部网络" msgid "Facets" msgstr "范围" msgid "Failed" msgstr "失败" msgid "Fault" msgstr "故障" msgid "Field Matches" msgstr "字段匹配" msgid "" "Find your cloud resources by selecting specific facets or by specifying " " full text search queries. Please refine your search or " " increase the limit setting." msgstr "" "结果数量超出页面限制。请重新搜索或者 " "增加数量上限。" msgid "Resume" msgstr "恢复" msgid "Resume updates to search results" msgstr "恢复对搜索结果的更新" msgid "Reverse Alphabetical Name" msgstr "按字母反序排序的名称" msgid "Revert Resize/Migrate" msgstr "放弃调整大小/迁移" msgid "Router" msgstr "路由器" msgid "Router ID" msgstr "路由器ID" msgid "Routers" msgstr "路由器" msgid "Rules" msgstr "规则" msgid "Running" msgstr "运行中" msgid "Saving" msgstr "保存中" msgid "Search" msgstr "搜索" msgid "Search Settings" msgstr "搜索设置" msgid "Search all projects" msgstr "搜索所有项目" msgid "Security Group" msgstr "安全组" msgid "Security Groups" msgstr "安全组" msgid "Server Group" msgstr "服务器组" msgid "Server Groups" msgstr "服务器组" msgid "Shared" msgstr "共享" msgid "Shared by Me" msgstr "我共享的" msgid "Shared with Me" msgstr "与我共享的" msgid "Shelved" msgstr "已搁置" msgid "Shelved Offloaded" msgstr "已搁置卸载" msgid "Shutdown" msgstr "关闭" msgid "Shutoff" msgstr "关机" msgid "Size" msgstr "大小" #, python-format msgid "Snapshot %s was successfully created." msgstr "快照%s曾被成功创建过。" msgid "Snapshot ID" msgstr "快照ID" msgid "Snapshot Name" msgstr "快照名称" msgid "Soft Deleted" msgstr "已执行软删除" msgid "Soft Reboot" msgstr "软重启" msgid "Sort" msgstr "排序" msgid "Source Volume ID" msgstr "源卷ID" msgid "Specs" msgstr "规范" msgid "Start" msgstr "启动" msgid "Start Time" msgstr "开始时间" msgid "State" msgstr "状态" msgid "Status" msgstr "状态" msgid "Stop" msgstr "关机" msgid "Stopped" msgstr "已停止" msgid "Subnet" msgstr "子网" msgid "Subnet Pool ID" msgstr "子网池ID" msgid "Subnets" msgstr "子网" msgid "Subnets Associated" msgstr "已关联子网" msgid "Suspend" msgstr "挂起" msgid "Suspended" msgstr "已挂起" msgid "Swap" msgstr "交换" msgid "Task State" msgstr "任务状态" msgid "Term Operators" msgstr "短语操作符" msgid "The current query is not valid. Please check your syntax." msgstr "当前查询不可用。请检查你的语法。" msgid "" "The following characters are reserved and must be " " escaped with a leading \ (backslash): " " + - = && || > < ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : \ " msgstr "" "以下是保留字符并且必须 " "用\（反斜扛）进行转义： " " + - = && || > < ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : \ " msgid "The requested resource was not found." msgstr "无法找到请求的资源。" msgid "The search service had an error processing your request." msgstr "搜索服务在执行你的请求的时候出现了错误。" msgid "There was an error processing your request." msgstr "在执行你的请求过程中出现了错误。" msgid "" "These settings impact the processing of results returned " " from the search service. Changing these settings may " " impact search performance and results." msgstr "" "这些设置会影响从搜索服务中返回结果的过程。改变这些设置可能会影响搜索操作和结" "果。" msgid "Transfer" msgstr "传输" msgid "Type" msgstr "类型" #, python-format msgid "Unable to delete Instance: %s." msgid_plural "Unable to delete Instances: %s." msgstr[0] "无法删除实例：%s。" msgid "Unable to execute the search." msgstr "无法执行搜索。" msgid "Unable to retrieve Searchlight resources types." msgstr "无法检索Searchlight资源类型。" msgid "Unable to retrieve search facets." msgstr "无法检索查找方向。" msgid "Unavailable" msgstr "不可用" msgid "Unpause" msgstr "继续运行" msgid "Up" msgstr "启动" msgid "Update Interval (seconds)" msgstr "更新间隔（秒）" msgid "Update Search" msgstr "更新搜索" msgid "Updated" msgstr "已更新" msgid "Updated At" msgstr "更新时间" msgid "" "Use parenthesis to group different aspects of your " " query to form sub-queries. For example, 'web OR (python AND " " apache)' will return anything that either has 'web' OR has both " " 'python' AND 'apache'." msgstr "" "使用圆括号对查询中的不同部分进行分组从而 " "形成子查询。例如，'web OR(python AND apache)' " "会返回所有包含'web'或者 " "同时包含'python'和'apache'的结果。" msgid "User ID" msgstr "用户ID" msgid "VCPUs" msgstr "CPU核数" msgid "Visibility" msgstr "可见性" msgid "" "Visibility is based on derived data. If Owned by Me, please inspect the " "resource to determine sharing status." msgstr "" "可见性是基于派生的数据的。如果是自己所拥有的，请检查资源以便确定共享的状态。" msgid "Volume" msgstr "卷" msgid "Volume Backup" msgstr "卷备份" msgid "Volume Backups" msgstr "卷备份" msgid "Volume ID" msgstr "卷ID" msgid "Volume Image Metadata" msgstr "卷镜像元数据" msgid "Volume Snapshot" msgstr "卷快照" msgid "Volume Snapshots" msgstr "卷快照" msgid "Volumes" msgstr "卷" msgid "Volumes Attached" msgstr "已连接卷" msgid "" "Warning: Wildcard queries place " " a heavy burden on the search service and may perform poorly." msgstr "" "警告：通配符查询会给搜索服务的后台产生 " "非常大的计算量，可能性能会比较差" msgid "Wildcards" msgstr "通配符" #, python-format msgid "You are not allowed to delete instances: %s" msgstr "你不能删除实例：%s" msgid "You are not allowed to perform this request." msgstr "你没有执行这个操作的权限。" msgid "" "You can increase or decrease the relevance of a search " " term by boosting different terms, phrases, or groups. Boost one " "of " " these by adding ^n to the term, phrase, or group where n is a " " number greater than 1 to increase relevance and between 0 and 1 " "to " " decrease relevance. For example 'web^4 python^0.1' would find " " anything with both web and python, but would increase the " " relevance for anything with 'web' in the result and decrease " "the " " relevance for anything with 'python' in the result." msgstr "" "你可以通过调整各个关键词、短语或者组的 " "权重来增加或者减少搜索关键词之间的相关 " "性。比如通过在关键词、短语或者组上 " "增加^n（n是一个数字，大于1时会增加相关性 " "介于0到1之间会减少相关性）。例如'web^4 python^0.1' " "会搜索所有包含web和python的结果，但是会 " "增加web在结果中的比重同时减少python在 " "结果中的比重。" msgid "" "You can separate search terms and groups with " " AND, OR and NOT (also written &&, || and !). For example, " " 'python OR javascript' will find anything with either term " " (OR is used by default, so does not need to be specified). " " However, 'python AND javascript' will find things that only " "have " " both terms. You can do this with as many terms as you'd like (e." "g. " " 'django AND javascript AND !unholy'). It is important to use " "all " " caps or the alternate syntax (&&, ||), because 'and' will be " " treated as another search term, but 'AND' will be treated as a " " logical operator." msgstr "" "你可以将搜索的短语用AND，OR或者NOT分开 " "（也可以写作&&, || 和 !）。例如，'python OR javascript' " "会搜索到只包含其中一个短语的结果（OR是默认使用的 " "，所以不需要单独写出来）。但是，'python AND javascript' " "会搜索到同时包含两个短语结果。你可以根据 " "自己的意愿使用任意数量的逻辑操作符 " "（例如：'django AND javascript AND !unholy'）。 " "记住逻辑操作符必须使用全大写或者 " "符号形式(&&, ||)，因为小写的'and'会被当作 " "另外一个被搜索的短语，但'AND'会被当作逻辑操作符。" msgid "" "You have exceeded the maximum ({$ ctrl.settings.general.limit_max $}) " "allowed." msgstr "你输入的值超过允许的最大值（{$ ctrl.settings.general.limit_max $}）。" msgid "" "You have exceeded the maximum ({$ ctrl.settings.polling.interval_max $}) " "allowed." msgstr "你超过了允许的最大值 ({$ ctrl.settings.polling.interval_max $})" msgid "" "You have gone below the minimum ({$ ctrl.settings.general.limit_min $}) " "allowed." msgstr "你输入的值小于允许的最小值（{$ ctrl.settings.general.limit_min $}）。" msgid "" "You have gone below the minimum ({$ ctrl.settings.polling.interval_min $}) " "allowed." msgstr "你低于允许的最小值 ({$ ctrl.settings.polling.interval_min $})" #, python-format msgid "You have selected "%s". Deleted instance is not recoverable." msgid_plural "You have selected "%s". Deleted instances are not recoverable." msgstr[0] "你已经选定了“%s”。删除实例的操作无法恢复。" msgid "" "You may decide to only look in a certain field for a " " search term by setting a specific facet. This is accomplished " "by " " either selecting a facet from the drop down or by typing the " "facet " " manually. For example, if you are looking for an image, you " " may choose to only look at the name field by adding 'name:foo'. commit_message:
WIP: Increase libvirt/qemu.conf max_files and max_processes

When Nova and/or Cinder are using Ceph as backend, qemu will need to
open a connection and two threads for each and every Ceph OSD.

This change raises the max_files (set to 1024 by default) to 32768 and
the max_processes (set to 4096 by default) to 131072. The max number
of FDs is per-process, while the max number of processes is
per-user. The values can be overridden via ExtraConfig, no params are
added to the templates.

A more detailed description of the values were chosen can be found at:
https://access.redhat.com/solutions/1602683

Unclean cherry-pick from I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb

Change-Id: I781b17482ec656f726a0fe33e9ab27d058a398fd
Depends-On: I258afd3ee6633e4b2ebc45aa8611be652476be0c
Closes-Bug: 1673995

commit_message:
Fix UnicodeEncodeError in Ceilometer polling

In PY3, all strings are sequences of unicode characters. In PY2,
a string may be of type str or of type unicode. Six provides
simple utilities for wrapping over differences between Python 2
and Python 3.[1] So using six.text_type instead of str to be more
compatible.
Python 2.x automatically encode the unicode with sys.getdefaultencoding(),
which is usually 'ascii'. If there are some non-ASCII characters, it can
raise UnicodeeEncodeError. Add a unit test that use unicode string to test
PartitionCoordinator to check if there have the same error in the bug.

[1] https://pythonhosted.org/six/#six.text_type

Change-Id: Ic52c805b81e53a632a61ddcd3e8652b5849d913d
Closes-Bug: #1621305

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I402581382915ea2da20f12d1b535a211539de99e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/14/447814/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The "L" is for "log" and the other letter comes from # the level. _LI = _translators.log_info _LW = _translators.log_warning _LE = _translators.log_error _LC = _translators.log_critical

commit_message:
Enable Images v1 API for glanceclient tests

Some functional tests for python-glanceclient require the the Images
v1 API, which has has been disabled by default in devstack since
change I7f962a07317cdad917ee896d79e49ee18938d074.  This patch enables
the v1 API for the glanceclient gates.

Change-Id: Iff36f64fc2f846443bf8eac24a485f188fac9ccf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/446627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc # Instantiates a credentials provider with admin credentials. cls._wait_for_user_role_on_project( project_id, user_id, cls.rbac_role_id) cls._wait_for_user_role_on_project( project_id, user_id, cls.admin_role_id) def _wait_for_user_role_on_project(cls, project_id, user_id, role_id, timeout=5): client = cls.creds_client.roles_client start_time = int(time.time()) while True: roles = client.list_user_roles_on_project(project_id, user_id)[ 'roles'] role_ids = [role['id'] for role in roles] if [role_id] == role_ids: return LOG.debug('SLEEPING') time.sleep(client.build_interval) timed_out = int(time.time()) - start_time >= timeout if timed_out: role_name = 'admin' if role_id == cls.admin_role_id else \ 'Member' message = 'Failed to find {0} role for user {1} on project '\ '{2} within {3} seconds.'.format(role_name, user_id, project_id, timeout) raise lib_exc.TimeoutException(message)

commit_message:
Remove old oslo.messaging transport aliases

Those are remnants from the oslo-incubator times. Also, oslo.messaging
deprecated [1] transport aliases since 5.2.0+ that is the minimal
version supported for stable/newton. The patch that bumped the minimal
version for Manila landed 3 months+ ago, so we can proceed ripping
those aliases from the code base.

[1] I314cefa5fb1803fa7e21e3e34300e5ced31bba89

Change-Id: Iea406d784bcef5c4c50e11a49cd967d0143d1d62
Closes-Bug: #1424728
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/93/447293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set deploywait_timeout in tempest config

Currently a hardcoded value is used for the DEPLOYWAIT timeout
in tempest.  Instead of this hardcoded value use the
deploywait_timeout config value.

Change-Id: Ie136382db18130af768945f4a02641a178d79e03

applied to system because of the _weed_out_duplicates method, they will

commit_message:
Don't add duplicate metadata rules after router update

For a HA router, when it's updated, the l3 agents which are standby
always call the after_router_added method, then duplicate metadata
rules are added to iptables table. Althrough these rules will not be
applied to system because of the _weed_out_duplicates method, they will
grow linearly with router update operations.

Because these metadata rules are added once router is added to the agent
and will not be cleaned until router is removed, calling the add_rule
method in after_router_updated is a waste.

This patch removes adding metadata rules in after_router_updated.

Change-Id: I6650f1071499ed6cabd936bb0fb36b32a4b60bca
Closes-Bug: #1658460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/423804/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 03:05:23.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/services/protection/provider.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/karbor/commit/e2d636cfb69933df0302e6ae12448df42f42d51f', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will be more readable.

In py2, the performance about list should be negligible

Change-Id: Ie3059edf2925b690191f628b32743bc6520a706d
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will be more readable.

In py2, the performance about list should be negligible

Change-Id: Ie3059edf2925b690191f628b32743bc6520a706d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/76/445276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import six for plugin_type, plugin_class in six.iteritems(self.plugins)

commit_message:
Update eventlet uc to 0.20.1

python 3.5 oslo.messaging functional test needs to be able to
monkeypatch the subprocess module, this feature is available since this
commit [1]. So we need something >= 0.20.

Related-Bug: #1655727

commit_message:
Enable Heat system tests

Since Ceilometer was removed from MOS 10.0 all system tests with
Ceilometer installation were disabled including Heat system tests.
Need to know that Ceilometer is required for only one Heat OSTF test
and it is enough to disable only one OSTF test instead all suite,
because otherwise we miss running and checking regular Heat scenarios.

Change-Id: Ieaa6c34c41824a0c3313eb60a615ccb5271797c6

commit_message:
Add command_prefix field to puppet mcagent

This will allow to run puppet with environment variables.
E.g. FACTER_foo=bar puppet apply ...

Change-Id: I1e435262e810ead46689078513607f6a99a19043
Implements: blueprint get-rid-cobbler-dnsmasq
(cherry picked from commit c734b030420c8ad78038ec5790e606f0c24ef616)

subject: Add CacheControl for Requests to global-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 20:36:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/178e763c4dfbe68df122915e84f79d33b22fcfbd', 'message': "Add CacheControl for Requests to global-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. It's also used heavily by python-pip and is the documented way of
  performing client-side caching with Requests (per their docs).

- Is the library good code?

  Yes. They have a large number of tests.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes. It's python 3 compatibility should never need questioning as it's
  a core dependency of pip.

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes. It's ASF licensed.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu: Yes, but for 16.10 (if the search is correct)
  Fedora: Yes.
  Gentoo: Yes.
  SUSE: No.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  It overlaps with dogpile.cache in name only. dogpile.cache is not so
  much concerned with caching as it is with memoization. CacheControl is
  concerned with Caching as defined by the HTTP RFCs.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  python-cratonclient. python-keystoneclient has an open review for
  similar behaviour and was also going to add a dependency on
  CacheControl but that review seems to have stalled.

Change-Id: I9f866f5091ca487a19b2e5cd4d66b04133a7d979

commit_message:
Add CacheControl for Requests to global-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. It's also used heavily by python-pip and is the documented way of
  performing client-side caching with Requests (per their docs).

- Is the library good code?

  Yes. They have a large number of tests.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes. It's python 3 compatibility should never need questioning as it's
  a core dependency of pip.

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes. It's ASF licensed.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu: Yes, but for 16.10 (if the search is correct)
  Fedora: Yes.
  Gentoo: Yes.
  SUSE: No.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  It overlaps with dogpile.cache in name only. dogpile.cache is not so
  much concerned with caching as it is with memoization. CacheControl is
  concerned with Caching as defined by the HTTP RFCs.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  python-cratonclient. python-keystoneclient has an open review for
  similar behaviour and was also going to add a dependency on
  CacheControl but that review seems to have stalled (see also
  I8d0dc1229309aac68586042d1e0d97efb161970f).

Change-Id: I9f866f5091ca487a19b2e5cd4d66b04133a7d979
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/64/397364/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch RootHelperProcess from select.poll to select.select

The new eventlet 0.20.x that the gate was recently bumped to [1] removed
select.poll [2]. Instead, we should use select.select that is both
supported by eventlet as well as available on all platforms.

[1] I534b8d7d6c2fa00c1fa7d84b3438e6e2b2fcad9e
[2] http://eventlet.net/doc/changelog.html#id2

Change-Id: Ie649abf495e00e7e05de47520ed89bbcd28360db
Closes-Bug: #1674557

commit_message:
raise eventlet version to 0.20.1

python 3.5 oslo.messaging functional test needs to be able to
monkeypatch the subprocess module, this feature is available since this
commit [1]. So we need something >= 0.20.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/614a20462aebfe85a54ce35a7daaf1a7dbde44a7

Change-Id: Id144002640b77e38d8ab734c465cf4aa8c58375e

commit_message:
Fix building ironic bootstrap

This patch fixes issues with building ironic bootstrap:
  * fix if condition that is a trigger to build ironic bootstrap
  * build fuel image always, ironic bootstrap only when ironic is enabled
  * Drop incorrect condition check for fuel image

Change-Id: Ib7ee0c656ffa71ce913e1924bb80260744319a3a
Closes-Bug: #1653204

commit_message:
Raise start limit burst for dnsmasq

When we provision nodes, we can
restart dnsmasq to frequently
this leads to systemd not starting
dnsmasq again, thus we have dnsmasq
stopped and deployment failing.

Raise limit to 100 starts in 10 seconds
and also sync cobbler on netboot disable

Partial-bug: #1667006

Change-Id: Id14bb2bb162f0a9fc6e0a9a102d98f4f2a6dcf1a
(cherry picked from commit 6b3d03b1677623ba2a9cc284e3346eec3cbea805)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/57/441957/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [Service] Restart=on-failure RestartSec=5 StartLimitIntervalSec=10 StartLimitBurst=100
